Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the normative process thoroughly The process starts with Receive order followed by Check inventory Depending on the inventory check result the process branches If inventory is sufficient the next steps are Authorize Payment Package Items Ship Order then Close Order If inventory is insufficient after Check Inventory it goes to Cancel Order then Close Order

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now looking at each case in the event log

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Activities Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close This follows the normal path perfectly No issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Activities Receive Check Package Authorize Ship Close Wait here they packaged before authorizing payment The normative process requires that Authorize payment must come after Check Inventory and before packaging Since Authorize Payment comes after Packaging here this is a violation The sequence is wrong because packaging cant happen until payment is authorized Thats a problem

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Cancel Ship Close Hmm after Cancel Order the process should end with Close Order immediately Shipping after a cancellation is definitely wrong Also why was Authorize Payment done before Cancel If inventory was insufficient they should have canceled right after Check Inventory so Authorizing Payment in that scenario is another violation So two issues here Authorizing Payment after insufficient inventory since they had to cancel and then Shipping after cancellation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait but the normative process says that if inventory is insufficient you go to Cancel and then Close Any activities after Cancel except Close are invalid So in this case after Cancel they did Ship and Close The Ship is a violation Also the Authorize Payment step before Cancel is wrong because if inventory is insufficient you shouldnt proceed to authorize payment The Check Inventory should lead directly to Cancel skipping Authorize So two violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Activities Receive Check Cancel Close This follows the insufficient inventory path correctly No issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Sequence Receive Check Authorize Ship Close Here after Authorize Payment they went straight to Ship without Packaging The norm requires that after Authorize you must Package Items before Shipping So missing the Packaging step between Authorize and Ship is a violation Also Ship should only occur after Packaging So thats an issue

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Let me double check each case again for other possible violations Case 2 The key violation is Package before Authorize Also does the norm say anything about the order between Authorize and Package Yes the description says Authorize payment must occur after Check and before packaging So yes thats a clear violation Case 3 The Cancel comes after Authorize But if inventory was insufficient the process should Cancel immediately after Check So Authorizing Payment after an insufficient inventory check is wrong Then the Ship after Cancel is also wrong Case 5 Missing the Package step between Authorize and Ship That skips a mandatory step so thats a violation

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the violating cases are 2 3 and 5 I need to list each cases violations clearly
